title: Function 'generate_review_comments' too long
explanation: Function generate_review_comments: 22 lines. Violates Single Responsibility Principle. Methods should ideally do one thing well.
suggestion: Extract 2-3 focused helper methods (e.g., for validation, computation, I/O) to improve readability and maintainability.

title: Unused imports detected
explanation: Unused imports like asdict increase file size and can cause confusion. They indicate dead code or incomplete refactoring.
suggestion: Remove all unused import statements to clean up the code, improve readability, and prevent potential naming conflicts. Use a linter to identify them.

title: Function 'cmd_scan' missing type hints
explanation: Function cmd_scan: no parameter or return type hints. Lack of type hints reduces code clarity and makes static analysis tools less effective, hindering developer understanding.
suggestion: Add type hints to function parameters and return values to improve code readability, enable static analysis, and reduce runtime errors.

title: Function 'cmd_review' uses many local variables
explanation: Function defines 9 local variables; consider splitting into smaller functions.. A large number of local variables often indicates that the function is doing too much and is hard to reason about.
suggestion: Split the function into smaller, focused helpers, each handling a clear subtask. This reduces cognitive load and makes testing easier.

title: Class 'CodeQualityAnalyzer' violates SRP
explanation: Class CodeQualityAnalyzer: 251loc, 12 methods. This class has too many responsibilities, making it hard to understand, test, and maintain.
suggestion: Split this class into several smaller, more focused classes, each handling a single responsibility. Consider patterns like Facade or Strategy.

title: Excessive nesting detected
explanation: Max nesting depth: 8. Deeply nested code reduces readability and increases cognitive load, creating 'arrow code' that is hard to follow.
suggestion: Use guard clauses, early returns, or refactor complex conditions into separate functions to flatten the code structure.

title: Function '_mark_unreachable_in_block' has too many parameters
explanation: Function _mark_unreachable_in_block: 5 parameters. A long parameter list makes a function harder to call, understand, and test.
suggestion: Group related parameters into a custom object (Data Transfer Object) or a named tuple. Consider if the function is doing too many things and can be split.

title: Method 'CodeQualityAnalyzer.analyze_file' may exhibit feature envy
explanation: Method uses attributes of 'ast' much more than 'self'; consider moving or refactoring.. When a method mostly uses another object's data instead of its own, it suggests the behavior may belong on that other object.
suggestion: Consider moving this behavior closer to the data it uses (e.g., onto the other class) or introducing a dedicated service/utility to own this logic.

title: Exceptions are being swallowed
explanation: Exception swallowed with broad 'except' and no real handling.. Swallowing exceptions (especially with bare 'except' or 'except Exception') hides real errors and makes debugging very difficult.
suggestion: Handle specific exception types and either log, re-raise, or convert them into meaningful error messages. Avoid bare 'except:' unless you re-raise immediately.

title: Unreachable code detected
explanation: Statement is unreachable (after return/raise/break/continue).. Code after a terminating statement (return/raise/break/continue) will never execute and can confuse future readers.
suggestion: Remove unreachable statements or refactor control flow so that all remaining code paths are actually executable.
